task.title: Configuring the server locale, date and time by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can set the server locale and timezone by using the locale set and timezone set commands on the command line. System administrators can set the current server date and time manually by using the datetime set command on the command line. System administrators can set the current server date and time automatically by using a network time protocol server. The network time protocol server settings can be configured using the set-ntp-servers command on the command line.
